body:
@kezhuw There is a problem with curator 5.7.0， As shown in the following jstack, an infinite loop occurs. I don't know if you've encountered it, or I'm using it.

"Curator-ConnectionStateManager-0" #441 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 cpu=53015334.98ms elapsed=240410.71s tid=0x00007fa9b0115000 nid=0x4b2 runnable [0x00007fa97a360000]

kezhuw:

The cause is multifold:

1. Error report to inBackground(callback).forPath(path) is not background.
2. Loop in the background callback.
3. CuratorFramework::watchers does not throw illegal state exception like others, say getData.
@frinda Thank you for reporting this! I have created CURATOR-729 for this.
@kezhuw When will the problem be solved，It's because of CURATOR-673: Complete BackgroundCallback if CuratorFramework got closed, right?

kezhuw:

I found more: reconfig, getConfig, watches and watchers.

I think we should either enforce checkState consistently or make inBackground operation background and never throw synchronously. The later probably require major refactor. So I would prefer to enforce checkState to all zk operations.

> When will the problem be solved

Probably 5.8.

> It's because of [CURATOR-673](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-673): Complete BackgroundCallback if CuratorFramework got closed, right?

This is my comment from JIRA.

> The cause is multifold:
>
> 1. Error report to inBackground(callback).forPath(path) is not background.
> 2. Loop in the background callback.
> 3. CuratorFramework::watchers does not throw illegal state exception like others, say getData.
>
> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-729?focusedCommentId=17910461&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-17910461

All CURATOR-673 done is issuing `BackgroundCallback` in all cases including curator closing. It is a good thing from my side.

I think we could enforce `checkState` to `CuratorFramework::reconfig`, `CuratorFramework::getConfig`, `CuratorFramework::watches` and `CuratorFramework::watchers`. See also CURATOR-529.
Hmm, I pushed to `apache/curator`. I will delete this pr branch once merged. Sorry for the mistake.

> See also [CURATOR-529](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-529).

 [CURATOR-529](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-529) hasn't provided a solution for a long time. Can you provide a solution or a PR  as soon as possible? Our version will be commercialized soon. Time is very tight.

> Probably 5.8

Can you offer a small version first, by January 15th?

> Can you offer a small version first, by January 15th?

No. The community has no time deadline. I think you could either patch whatever solution you want or downgrade curator version.

> No. The community has no time deadline. I think you could either patch whatever solution you want or downgrade curator version.
 

I don't know how to change， Can you provide a solution or PR as soon as possible?

> +1 to global compression
> 
> > When using this flag with a custom CompressionProvider, this can easily allow for a filtered compression implementation.
> 
> I saw no per-operation way to opt out compression if it is enabled global while we have method to turn it on if it is not enabled globally. People will have to override `CompressionProvider` which complicate things.
> 
> I checked `CreateBuilder`, `SetDataBuilder`, `AsyncCreateBuilder`, `AsyncSetDataBuilder` and `GetDataBuilder`.

So I've gone ahead and added negative methods for both `Compressible` and `Decompressible`. I need to add tests for everything, but the Async APIs should be fully covered now too. Lots of ways to do everything, so lots of things to test here to make sure nothing got missed....

> I think we could enforce checkState to CuratorFramework::reconfig, CuratorFramework::getConfig, CuratorFramework::watches and CuratorFramework::watchers. See also [CURATOR-529](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-529).

@kezhuw  We cannot try to reproduce the problem. Can you give some specific repair suggestions?

JIRAUSER305948:

Zili Chen sry, I'm busy these days. Is there any released version I can try? Or do I need to compile it from the master branch?

OK. I'll merge this PR in these days.

Let's keep the JIRA project for a while, recommend/ensure users to report new issues on GitHub. Manually migrate existing tickets to GitHub Issues, and finally archive/readonly the JIRA project.

tison:

Never mind.

Kuradeon There is no release containing this fix. So you'd welcome to test it by building from source against the master branch. I hope we will release 5.8.0 including this patch by the end of Feb.

According to the conversation with the INFRA team on Slack:

> [@tisonkun] If we can turn on GitHub Issues, we can encourage/ensure new issues goes to GitHub Issues, and softly depreacted the JIRA project. But IIRC I was told not to do so because the INFRA team may finish it at once. So I don't know if, by my turning on the GitHub Issues, I'd unexpectedly break some assumption by the INFRA team.
>
> [INFRA member] I dont think it will break anything as such. PRs and Issues both get their numbering scheme from the same pool. You have over 500 PRs already so when importing issues, CURATOR-1 will start at the first available number - currrently `#520`. etc etc. The import process has a mapping system whereas it will link the Issue imported back to the original Jira ticket. If desired a final comment is also added to each Jira ticket pointing to the migrated Github Issue.

So I'd merge this PR now and let's move forward.
When will a new tag be released?
@kezhuw thank you for fixing this. It helps to unblock our upgrade to Zookeeper 3.9.3. Do you know when will be the next release that include this patch ?
@yang-wei There is no schedule for next release yet. You could post mail to dev mailing list to let the community know.

https://github.com/apache/curator/actions/runs/12776632629 is completed, but I did find no build scans in https://develocity.apache.org/scans?search.rootProjectNames=curator.

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=INFRA&title=Project+Onboarding+Instructions+for+Develocity

This doc states that the secret is named `GE_ACCESS_TOKEN`.

cc @clayburn

@kezhuw 

> This doc states that the secret is named GE_ACCESS_TOKEN.

Thanks for pointing this out. It got missed in the migration yesterday. It is now updated.

> https://github.com/apache/curator/actions/runs/12776632629 is completed, but I did find no build scans in https://develocity.apache.org/scans?search.rootProjectNames=curator.

The build scan will not publish from this PR, since my fork cannot access the secret, but post merge the secret is accessible. You can see this from other projects like Beam which [access the secret](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/98122f3b93bc5bfb9eb1f5c1c6162f73fd6ebb8a/.github/workflows/beam_Java_JMH.yml#L47) and are successfully [publishing build scans](https://develocity.apache.org/scans?search.rootProjectNames=beam&search.timeZoneId=America%2FChicago).

kezhuw:

Superceded by CURATOR-673  and CURATOR-729.
@kezhuw would you consider this is a release blocker? I may expect to call a release by the end of Feb. and now try to collaborate to converge the ongoing PRs.

> would you consider this is a release blocker? 

No. It is not even a bug.

Ok, should have fully added tests here. Not every single method is tested, but every use case is with lots of corner cases.

I think this should be ready to go
@HoustonPutman Thanks for your contribution! Merged now :D
